title: Ticket #7283: submit utils should provide a $(SUBMIT_TIME) expansion
description:
There is a fairly hacky way to get the current time formatted in various ways in a submit file like this 
submit fragment
date=formatTime(time(),"%m_%d")
log = test_$STRING(date).log
Which will produce a file named test_09_04.log on September 4th. But this is fairly obscure, and it won't necessarly work correctly all of the time because time() gets a new value for each job in the submit.

What is needed is first class access to the submit time (the job's Qdate attribute), and we should expose the most likely use cases as first-class submit variables.

  • $(SUBMIT_TIME) the unix timestamp value that Qdate will be set to
  • $(YEAR) the 4 digit year of Qdate
  • $(MONTH) the 2 digit month of Qdate
  • $(DAY) the 2 digit day-of-month of Qdate

Other time values can be achieved by passing $(SUBMIT_TIME) to the classad time formatting function 

submit fragment
isotime=formatTime($(SUBMIT_TIME), "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S")
Arguments = -time "$STRING(isotime)"
